title: CLI Integration & Distribution
description:
Integrate the Go SpecLedger CLI with the bash sl bootstrap script, enabling unified project initialization where the CLI binary is automatically built and available. Create cross-platform build automation and distribution packages for CLI toolkit.

**User Stories:**
1. P1: Initialize Project with CLI Tools - sl creates project with CLI binary available
2. P2: Use Single Command for All Spec Operations - unified CLI access without setup
3. P3: Build and Distribute CLI Toolkit - cross-platform builds and distribution
4. P3: Vendor Specs for Offline Development - offline spec access via vendor command

**Technical Context:** Go 1.24.0, cobra CLI framework, bash integration, static binaries
**Performance:** Build < 30s, CLI commands < 100ms

- Build time set to current time
- --version flag displays all metadata in format: specledger version: X.Y.Z followed by commit and build time
- Makefile build command injects versions via -X main.version=...

Problem: Users on different platforms need CLI binaries that work for their system.

Implementation: Enhance Makefile with cross-platform build targets.

Files: Makefile

References:
- plan.md (Technical Context)
- research.md (Area 3: Cross-Platform Build Patterns)
- contracts/makefile.builds
- data-model.md (Distribution Package entity)

Acceptance:
- make build compiles CLI for current platform
- make build-linux-amd64 creates binary in dist/specledger-linux-amd64
- make build-darwin-amd64 creates binary in dist/specledger-darwin-amd64
- make build-darwin-arm64 creates binary in dist/specledger-darwin-arm64
- make build-windows-amd64 creates binary in dist/specledger-windows-amd64.exe
- All binaries use CGO_ENABLED=0 for static linking
- All binaries use -ldflags="-s -w" for size reduction
- All binaries include version injection via ldflags
- All binaries are marked executable
- Binary sizes are reasonable (~4MB)
- All build targets can run in sequence via make build-all
- Error messages are clear for platform-specific issues
- Existing Makefile functionality preserved

title: Spec Dependency Linking
description: Implement golang-style dependency locking and linking for specifications, allowing teams to declare external spec dependencies, resolve them with cryptographic verification, and reference specific sections across repositories.
notes:
COMPLETED: Full Spec Dependency Linking feature implementation across 5 user stories (32 tasks). 

**Features Implemented:**
- US1: Dependency Declaration (deps add/list/resolve/update)
- US2: External References Validation (refs validate/list with strict mode)
- US3: Version Management (update command, force flag)
- US4: Conflict Detection (duplicates, circular, version conflicts)
- US5: Vendoring (vendor/clean/update for offline use)

**Technical Stack:**
- Go 1.21+ with Cobra CLI
- go-git/v5 for Git operations
- SHA-256 cryptographic hashing for lockfiles
- Manifest (spec.mod) and lockfile (spec.sum) formats

**Commands:**
- sl deps resolve/update - Manage dependencies
- sl refs validate/list - Validate external references
- sl conflict check/detect - Find dependency conflicts
- sl vendor/update/clean - Vendor specs offline
